DellRoad Stuff Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2017-07-18  | Version: 2.2.1
DellRoad Stuff Maven Plugin
Parent Project
  • DellRoad Stuff
Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

dellroad-stuff:git-describe

Full name:

org.dellroad:dellroad-stuff-maven-plugin:2.2.1:git-describe

Description:

Sets a Maven project property based on the output of git describe.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • The goal is thread-safe and supports parallel builds.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
abbrev int - Instead of using the default 7 hexadecimal digits as the abbreviated object name, use this many digits, or as many digits as needed to form a unique object name. A value of 0 will suppress long format, only showing the closest tag.
Default value is: -1.
User property is: abbrev.
all boolean - Instead of using only the annotated tags, use any ref found in refs/ namespace. This option enables matching any known branch, remote-tracking branch, or lightweight tag.
Default value is: false.
User property is: all.
always boolean - Show uniquely abbreviated commit object as fallback.
Default value is: false.
User property is: always.
candidates int - Instead of considering only the 10 most recent tags as candidates to describe the input consider up to this many candidates. Increasing this value above 10 will take slightly longer but may produce a more accurate result. A value of 0 will cause only exact matches to be output.
Default value is: -1.
User property is: candidates.
committish String - Commit-ish object name to describe. Defaults to HEAD if not set. Note: this property is incompatible with dirty.
User property is: committish.
contains boolean - Instead of finding the tag that predates the commit, find the tag that comes after the commit, and thus contains it. Automatically implies tags.
Default value is: false.
User property is: contains.
dirty String - Describe the working tree. It means describe HEAD and appends the configured value if the working tree is dirty. Note: this property is incompatible with committish.
User property is: dirty.
exactMatch boolean - Only output exact matches (a tag directly references the supplied commit). This is the same as setting candidates to zero.
Default value is: false.
User property is: exactMatch.
firstParent boolean - Follow only the first parent commit upon seeing a merge commit. This is useful when you wish to not match tags on branches merged in the history of the target commit.
Default value is: false.
User property is: firstParent.
longFormat boolean - Always output the long format (the tag, the number of commits and the abbreviated commit name) even when it matches a tag. This is useful when you want to see parts of the commit object name in "describe" output, even when the commit in question happens to be a tagged version. Instead of just emitting the tag name, it will describe such a commit as v1.2-0-gdeadbee (0th commit since tag v1.2 that points at object deadbee....).
Default value is: false.
User property is: long.
match String - Only consider tags matching the given glob(7) pattern, excluding the refs/tags/ prefix. This can be used to avoid leaking private tags from the repository.
User property is: match.
propertyName String - The name of the Maven property to set.
Default value is: git.describe.
User property is: propertyName.
tags boolean - Instead of using only the annotated tags, use any tag found in refs/tags namespace. This option enables matching a lightweight (non-annotated) tag.
Default value is: false.
User property is: tags.
workingDirectory File - The git(1) working directory where the code is checked out.
Default value is: ${project.directory}.
User property is: workingDirectory.

Parameter Details

abbrev:

Instead of using the default 7 hexadecimal digits as the abbreviated object name, use this many digits, or as many digits as needed to form a unique object name. A value of 0 will suppress long format, only showing the closest tag.
  • Type: int
  • Required: No
  • User Property: abbrev
  • Default: -1

all:

Instead of using only the annotated tags, use any ref found in refs/ namespace. This option enables matching any known branch, remote-tracking branch, or lightweight tag.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: all
  • Default: false

always:

Show uniquely abbreviated commit object as fallback.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: always
  • Default: false

candidates:

Instead of considering only the 10 most recent tags as candidates to describe the input consider up to this many candidates. Increasing this value above 10 will take slightly longer but may produce a more accurate result. A value of 0 will cause only exact matches to be output.
  • Type: int
  • Required: No
  • User Property: candidates
  • Default: -1

committish:

Commit-ish object name to describe. Defaults to HEAD if not set. Note: this property is incompatible with dirty.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: committish

contains:

Instead of finding the tag that predates the commit, find the tag that comes after the commit, and thus contains it. Automatically implies tags.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: contains
  • Default: false

dirty:

Describe the working tree. It means describe HEAD and appends the configured value if the working tree is dirty. Note: this property is incompatible with committish.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: dirty

exactMatch:

Only output exact matches (a tag directly references the supplied commit). This is the same as setting candidates to zero.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: exactMatch
  • Default: false

firstParent:

Follow only the first parent commit upon seeing a merge commit. This is useful when you wish to not match tags on branches merged in the history of the target commit.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: firstParent
  • Default: false

longFormat:

Always output the long format (the tag, the number of commits and the abbreviated commit name) even when it matches a tag. This is useful when you want to see parts of the commit object name in "describe" output, even when the commit in question happens to be a tagged version. Instead of just emitting the tag name, it will describe such a commit as v1.2-0-gdeadbee (0th commit since tag v1.2 that points at object deadbee....).
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: long
  • Default: false

match:

Only consider tags matching the given glob(7) pattern, excluding the refs/tags/ prefix. This can be used to avoid leaking private tags from the repository.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: match

propertyName:

The name of the Maven property to set.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: propertyName
  • Default: git.describe

tags:

Instead of using only the annotated tags, use any tag found in refs/tags namespace. This option enables matching a lightweight (non-annotated) tag.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: tags
  • Default: false

workingDirectory:

The git(1) working directory where the code is checked out.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: No
  • User Property: workingDirectory
  • Default: ${project.directory}
